passages.text:
Ansel::TRANSFER NEEDED PLAUSIBLE EXPLANATION AS PROMOTION STOP VERA EXTREMELY COMPETENT UNFORTUNATELY STOP EVEN TRIED GIVING BAD ASSIGNMENTS TO JUSTIFY DEMOTION BEFORE RESTORTING TO PROMOTION STOP I AM SORRY

[[C->Page 7]]
passages.name: Page 6

passages.text:
Tann::THE HELL WERE YOU THINKING STOP WHY SEND VERA TO THIS DEPARTMENT SNOOPING NOSE WHERE DOES NOT BELONG STOP POTENTIALLY DISATROUS

[[C->Page 2]]
passages.name: Page 1

passages.text:
Ansel::EVEN WORSE IN SATURN CORE STOP NO MATTER HOW BAD YOU THINK YOU HAVE IT SHE WAS MUCH HIGHER RISK HERE

Ferryman::"Vera."  Sounds as though they are discussing the woman who authored that diary we found earlier.

[[C->Page 3]]
passages.name: Page 2

passages.text:
Tann::WHY NOT TERMINATE HER STOP NOT SAFE IN ANY BURO STOP TOO NOSY NOTICES DISCREPANCIES LIKE HAWK STOP WHY US

[[C->Page 4]]
passages.name: Page 3

passages.text:
Ansel::VERA EXTREMELY PRODUCTIVE JUDGED BY QUANTITATIVE METRICS AND FAMILY WELL CONNECTED WITH ADMIN STOP TERMINATION WOULD BE OPTICAL DISASTER FROM MANY ANGLES STOP ORDER CAME STRAIGHT FROM ROSALIND

Jasper,head_tilted::There it is again - that chill.

Ferryman,surprised::"Rosalind" - there it is again, that name.  Do you think they are referring to your Mom?

[[p:Probably.  She was often tasked with overseeing the transfer of staff.  Let's keep going.->Page 5]]

links.name: p:Probably.  She was often tasked with overseeing the transfer of staff.  Let's keep going.

passages.name: Page 4

passages.text:
Tann::SEND BEAN COUNTER SOMEWHERE SHE CANT DO MUCH DAMAGE STOP RELEGATE TO THEATER DEPT OR FOOD PRODUCT BURO STOP IF SHE FINDS OUT TOO MUCH BAD FOR BOTH OF US

[[C->Page 6]]
passages.name: Page 5

passages.text:
Tann::YOU ARE USELESS

You've reached the end of the stack.

Ferryman,looking_to_side::Interesting exchange, but it doesn't tell us much about your Mom, other than that she didn't want Vera hanging around the SATURN core.  

Ferryman,neutral::We should probably keep looking for the rest of Vera's notes, they might prove more illuminating.

[[p:Agreed.  But, I am curious why they were so terrified of Vera.  Makes you wonder what they were trying to hide.]]

links.name: p:Agreed.  But, I am curious why they were so terrified of Vera.  Makes you wonder what they were trying to hide.
links.link: p:Agreed.  But, I am curious why they were so terrified of Vera.  Makes you wonder what they were trying to hide.

passages.name: Page 7

passages.text:
Before you sits a small desk hosting an antique typewriter.  The scene is tastefully backlit by a pair of partially smashed stained glass windows.  
The details of the room are relatively ornate.  This office likely belonged to someone "high up" within the administrative staff.

[[p:(Action) Rummage through the desk.]]
passages.name: Untitled Passage

passages.text:
Upon searching the desk, you discover a neatly stacked set of withered telegram cards, layered in the order of their delivery and reception.

[[p:(Action) Read through the stack of telegram cards->Page 1]]

links.name: p:(Action) Read through the stack of telegram cards

passages.name: p:(Action) Rummage through the desk.

passages.text:
Ferryman,looking_to_side::Yeah, I don't know.  Couldn't be anything too nefarious if they were willing to just leave telegrams like this in unsecured office drawers - if it was something serious they'd be more cautious.

Jasper,twisted::He seems eager to move on from this train of thought.  I encourage indulging him.

[[p:Alright.  Let's go find the rest of Vera's diary entries.]]

links.name: p:Alright.  Let's go find the rest of Vera's diary entries.
links.link: p:Alright.  Let's go find the rest of Vera's diary entries.

passages.name: p:Agreed.  But, I am curious why they were so terrified of Vera.  Makes you wonder what they were trying to hide.

passages.text: The Ferryman nods.  You return the telegrams to the desk and continue on your way.
passages.name: p:Alright.  Let's go find the rest of Vera's diary entries.
